There are several options for creating a community and audience for people who sign up for your services. Here are a few:

1. Facebook Groups: Facebook groups are a great option for building a community. You can create a private group where members can interact with each other and with your brand. You can also use the group to share valuable content, promote your services, and get feedback from your members.
2. Slack: Slack is a messaging app that's great for building a community. You can create channels for different topics and invite members to join. You can use Slack to share content, answer questions, and get feedback from your members.
3. Discord: Discord is a communication app designed for gaming communities, but it's also great for building communities around other topics. You can create different channels for different topics, and use it to share content, answer questions, and build relationships with your members.
4. LinkedIn Groups: LinkedIn groups are a great option if you're targeting a B2B audience. You can create a private group and invite members to join. You can use the group to share valuable content, promote your services, and network with other professionals in your industry.

To create a community on these platforms, you can start by inviting your email list and social media followers to join. You can also promote your community on your website and in your email signature. Once you have members, you can start engaging with them by sharing valuable content, answering questions, and creating opportunities for them to connect with each other.
